app.services package¶

Submodules¶

app.services.driver module¶

app.services.driver.calculate_distance(lat1: float, lng1: float, lat2: float, lng2: float) → float[source]¶

Calculate the distance between two points using the Haversine formula. Returns distance in kilometers.

app.services.driver.find_nearest_idle_driver(cafe_lat: float, cafe_lng: float, db: Session) → tuple[User, float] | None[source]¶

Find the nearest idle driver to a cafe location. Returns (driver_user, distance_in_km) or None if no idle drivers found.

app.services.driver.get_driver_current_location(driver_id: int, db: Session) → DriverLocation | None[source]¶

Get the current location and status of a driver.

app.services.driver.get_idle_drivers_with_locations(db: Session) → list[dict][source]¶

Get all idle drivers with their current locations. Returns list of dictionaries with driver info and location.

app.services.driver.get_latest_driver_location(driver_id: int, db: Session) → DriverLocation | None[source]¶

Get the most recent location for a driver.

app.services.driver.update_driver_status_to_idle(driver_id: int, db: Session) → DriverLocation | None[source]¶

Update the driver’s status to IDLE when they complete a delivery. Creates a new location record with IDLE status.

app.services.driver.update_driver_status_to_occupied(driver_id: int, db: Session) → DriverLocation | None[source]¶

Update the driver’s status to OCCUPIED when they take an order. Creates a new location record with OCCUPIED status.

app.services.ocr module¶

class app.services.ocr.OCRService[source]¶

Bases: object

extract_text_from_file(file_bytes: bytes, file_type: str, filename: str = 'file') → str[source]¶

Extract text from file (PDF or image) using Mistral OCR API.

Parameters:

  • file_bytes – File content as bytes

  • file_type – File type (‘pdf’, ‘png’, ‘jpg’, ‘jpeg’, etc.)

  • filename – Original filename (optional)

Returns:

Extracted text content (markdown format)

extract_text_from_image(image_bytes: bytes) → str[source]¶

Extract text from an image using Mistral OCR API.

Parameters:

image_bytes – Image file content as bytes

Returns:

Extracted text content (markdown format)

extract_text_from_pdf(file_bytes: bytes, filename: str = 'menu.pdf') → str[source]¶

Extract text from PDF using Mistral OCR API.

Parameters:

  • file_bytes – PDF file content as bytes

  • filename – Filename for the PDF (optional)

Returns:

Extracted text content (markdown format)

parse_menu_with_mistral(ocr_text: str) → List[OCRMenuItem][source]¶

Use Mistral API to parse OCR text and extract structured menu items. Matches ItemCreate schema format.

Parameters:

ocr_text – Raw text content extracted from OCR (markdown format)

Returns:

List of structured menu items matching ItemCreate schema

app.services.ocr.parse_menu_file(file_bytes: bytes, file_type: str, filename: str = 'file') → List[OCRMenuItem][source]¶

Main function to parse menu file (PDF or image) and extract structured menu items.

Parameters:

  • file_bytes – File content as bytes (PDF or image)

  • file_type – File type/extension (e.g., ‘pdf’, ‘png’, ‘jpg’)

  • filename – Original filename (optional)

Returns:

List of OCRMenuItem objects matching ItemCreate schema

app.services.ocr.parse_menu_pdf(file_bytes: bytes) → List[OCRMenuItem][source]¶

Legacy function for backward compatibility. Parse a menu PDF and extract structured menu items.

Parameters:

file_bytes – PDF file content as bytes

Returns:

List of OCRMenuItem objects

app.services.recommend module¶

app.services.recommend.daily_calorie_recommendation(height_cm: float, weight_kg: float, sex: str, age_years: int, activity: str) → int[source]¶

Calculate daily calorie recommendation using revised Harris-Benedict BMR formula with activity multiplier.

async static summarize_reviews(db: Session, cafe_id: int, force: bool = False)[source]¶
